awd_titl_txt: SGER: A Human-Centered System for Virtual Part Disassembly  and Replacement
awd_abstract_narration: 9615689  Lumelsky        This award funds exploration of a novel sensor-based  approach to disassembly planning for complex assemblies.  Knowledge of part and tool kinematics and available tools, and  procedures for disassembling a complex assembly could aid the  designer in producing a more maintainable system or structure.  The planned approach operates with incomplete information,  enabling a computationally efficient answer to the formal  question of existence of a path for removal of a given part from  a complex assembly.  This exploratory effort should show the way  to the formulation of the more general questions for design such  as how the kinematic constraints as well as tool and system  maintenance procedure availability can be accommodated in design  and planning.Incorporation of such knowledge in the original  design process could also facilitate human performance of  disassembly operations in some cases.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
